sentences.en: A bit of charm and humour would not go amiss.
sentences.cn: 人有点吸引力和幽默感总是好的。

sentences.en: A little luck wouldn't go amiss right now!
sentences.cn: 现在要是交点好运倒也不错!

sentences.en: Everything goes amiss with him, he has certainly bad luck.
sentences.cn: 他事事不如意, 运气真不好.

sentences.en: His joke was taken amiss by some of the company.
sentences.cn: 他开玩笑的话使几个朋友不高兴.

sentences.en: Nothing has ever gone amiss since he took charge of the school.
sentences.cn: 自他主管这所学校以来,还从未出过问题.
我并不是在准备打仗,只是小心谨慎罢了.

sentences.en: Please don't take it amiss if I venture to point out your errors.
sentences.cn: 假如我冒昧指出你的错误,请不要见怪.

sentences.en: Please don't take it amiss, if I point out your errors.
sentences.cn: 假如我指出你的错,请别见怪.

sentences.en: She sensed something was amiss and called the police.
sentences.cn: 她觉得有点不对头，就叫了警察。

sentences.en: She sensed something was amiss right now!
sentences.cn: 她觉得有点不对头,就叫了警察.

sentences.en: The cracks are showing in the walls and a lick of paint would not come amiss.
sentences.cn: 墙面开始出现裂缝了，刷一点油漆就能补好。

sentences.en: Their instincts warned them something was amiss.
sentences.cn: 他们直觉上感到有什么地方不对劲儿。

sentences.en: There is something amiss with the machine.
There was nothing amiss that I could see.
sentences.cn: 我看不出来有什么不恰当的地方.

sentences.en: you look as if a good meal wouldn't come amiss.
sentences.cn: 看你的样子好好吃一顿是合你意的。

words.tran_cn: 有毛病的，有缺陷的；出差错的

phrases.phrase: something would not go (或 come) amiss

trans.tran_cn: 出了差错的，有毛病的，有缺陷的，（用于否定句）不恰当的
trans.tran_en: If you say that something is amiss, you mean there is something wrong
